title: China Development Bank provides financing to Trade and Development Bank of Mongolia for purchases of Chinese goods
description: According to the 2020 Annual Report of the Trade & Development Bank (TDB) of Mongolia, in 2020, China Development Bank signed a USD and RMB financing agreement with the Trade and Development Bank of Mongolia. The purpose of the project is to help TDB's customers finance their trade with Chinese companies at a lower cost under the “Belt and Road” initiative. Details of the financing agreement are unclear.
combined_text:
# Sector
UNALLOCATED/UNSPECIFIED

# Title
China Development Bank provides financing to Trade and Development Bank of Mongolia for purchases of Chinese goods

# Description
According to the 2020 Annual Report of the Trade & Development Bank (TDB) of Mongolia, in 2020, China Development Bank signed a USD and RMB financing agreement with the Trade and Development Bank of Mongolia. The purpose of the project is to help TDB's customers finance their trade with Chinese companies at a lower cost under the “Belt and Road” initiative. Details of the financing agreement are unclear.
justification: Project involves financial services for trade financing without specific environmental or energy-related components
evidence: Financing agreement for trade with Chinese companies, no specific project details provided

title: China donates anti-epidemic materials to Montenegro in April 2020
description: On April 16, 2020, anti-epidemic materials donated by the Chinese government to fight against the COVID-19 pandemic arrived in Montenegro. The donation was received by representatives from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

title: Chinese government commits to establish of Chinese-Moroccan Center for Traditional Medicine with Moroccan government
description: On August 18, 2019, Chinese delegations from the Chinese National Health Commission proposed the establishment of a Chinese-Moroccan Center for Traditional Medicine in Casablanca. The meeting was held at the 2nd Chinese-Arab Health Forum.   On January 3, 2020, the Chinese ambassador to Morocco signed the agreement with the Moroccan authorities to officially establish this center. The Hassan II University in Casablanca and Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine will implement the project.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese government commits to establish of Chinese-Moroccan Center for Traditional Medicine with Moroccan government

# Description
On August 18, 2019, Chinese delegations from the Chinese National Health Commission proposed the establishment of a Chinese-Moroccan Center for Traditional Medicine in Casablanca. The meeting was held at the 2nd Chinese-Arab Health Forum.   On January 3, 2020, the Chinese ambassador to Morocco signed the agreement with the Moroccan authorities to officially establish this center. The Hassan II University in Casablanca and Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine will implement the project.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare and education collaboration without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Traditional Medicine Center, collaboration between universities, healthcare focus

title: China’s Guizhou Province provides anti-epidemic supplies to Morocco in March 2020
description: On March 23, 2020, China’s Guizhou Province provided anti-epidemic supplies to Morocco. The supplies arrived on a Royal Air Maroc cargo plane in Casablanca, Morocco. The donation included 15,000 pairs of medical gloves, 20,000 N95 protective masks, 2,000 pieces of medical protective clothing, and other medical supplies. These supplies will be used to improve COVID-19 prevention efforts in Morocco.   The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:

title: China Development Bank provides anti-epidemic supplies to Morocco in May 2020
description: On May 14, 2020, the Chinese Development Bank provided anti-epidemic supplies to Morocco. The supplies arrived at Casablanca International Airport in Morocco. The supplies included 36 ventilators and 98,000 disposable medical masks. These supplies will be used to improve COVID-19 response efforts in Morocco. The monetary value of this donation is unknown, but "the value of this donation is the highest among all those made by the Chinese bank abroad to date," said Bank of Africa (BOA) in a press release.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

evidence: Anti-epidemic supplies including ventilators and medical masks, focus on healthcare improvement

title: Ningxia Hui government provides anti-epidemic supplies to Morocco in June 2020
description: On June 8, 2020, the government of Ningxia Hui, a city in China, provided anti-epidemic supplies to Morocco. The supplies included 2,000 medical masks, 25,000 surgical masks, and 2,000 personal protective suits. The supplies were transported from Yinchuan, the regional capital, to Casablanca-Settat in Morocco where they will be distributed across the Casablanca-Settat region of Morocco to improve COVID-19 response efforts. They will be delivered through the Chinese embassy in Morocco. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  The region of Casablanca-Settat signed an agreement on establishing relations of friendly exchanges with Ningxia in January 2006. It is one of eight international friendship cities to receive medical assistance from the Ningxia Hui government.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:

# Description

The supplies were transported from Yinchuan, the regional capital, to Casablanca-Settat in Morocco where they will be distributed across the Casablanca-Settat region of Morocco to improve COVID-19 response efforts. The region of Casablanca-Settat signed an agreement on establishing relations of friendly exchanges with Ningxia in January 2006. justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for COVID-19 response, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Anti-epidemic supplies including masks and protective suits, focused on improving COVID-19 response efforts

title: Chinese government provides 7.15 million Moroccan dirhams to the Morocco Ministry of Health and Social Protection for general health system support
description: In 2020, the Chinese government provided 7.15 million Moroccan dirhams in total grant funding to Morocco's Ministry of Health and Social Protection to broadly support the country's health system. More specifically, 2.65 million dirhams were provided via the value of in-kind donations of medical devices and medicines to hospitals in which Chinese medical teams were stationed. The remaining 4.5 million dirhams were used to strengthen human resources associated with the Ministry's health information systems.  The Moroccan Ministry of Health explicitly considered the projects supported by these funds to be non-COVID-19 related.
staff_comments: 1. An additional 7 million Moroccan dirhams were granted by the Chinese government to Morocco's Ministry of Health specifically for COVID-19 mitigation. However, this amount is an aggregate, the majority of which (if not its entirety) is captured in other AidData records of in-kind donations by Chinese government entities. To avoid double counting, this 7 million has been excluded from this project's transaction amount.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese government provides 7.15 million Moroccan dirhams to the Morocco Ministry of Health and Social Protection for general health system support

# Description
In 2020, the Chinese government provided 7.15 million Moroccan dirhams in total grant funding to Morocco's Ministry of Health and Social Protection to broadly support the country's health system. More specifically, 2.65 million dirhams were provided via the value of in-kind donations of medical devices and medicines to hospitals in which Chinese medical teams were stationed. The remaining 4.5 million dirhams were used to strengthen human resources associated with the Ministry's health information systems.  The Moroccan Ministry of Health explicitly considered the projects supported by these funds to be non-COVID-19 related.
justification: Project focuses on general health system support without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Funding for medical devices, medicines, and health information systems, explicitly non-COVID-19 related

title: Chinese Government provides anti-epidemic equipment to the Government of Mozambique
description: On June 3, 2020, a handover ceremony was held for the "second batch" of anti-epidemic supplies, which included N95 masks, surgical masks, medical gowns, medical goggles, shoe protection, and gloves, from an unspecified organization within the Chinese Government to the Government of Mozambique.
staff_comments: 1. This was identified as the second COVID-related donation from China to Mozambique, but the stage one coder could not find evidence of a first donation. See ProjectID#92166, which functions as a placeholder project for the first donation.

title: Chinese Defense Ministry provides donation of 13 tons of medical equipment to Maputo Hospital
description: On June 17, 2020, the Chinese Defense Ministry handed over 13 tons of medical protective equipment, including gloves, masks, thermometers, and 60 other boxes of unspecified equipment, to the Maputo Military Hospital to help fight COVID-19.
